name: LinkedIn Poll
primary_goal_vibe: Insight gathering, engagement, and conversation-starting around a focused question.
tone_preference: Clear, neutral to slightly opinionated, and professional. Designed to spark thoughtful responses, not just clicks.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: Ask one specific, non-ambiguous question. Provide answer options that are mutually exclusive and collectively sensible. Use the post text to frame why the question matters, and invite comments to deepen the discussion.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Line 1: the core question or a short setup. Body: 1–3 lines explaining why this matters or what you are trying to understand. Final line: explicit invitation to vote and comment.
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Short. Focused on clarity and context.
cta_examples: Vote and share your reasoning in the comments
Curious how others handle this, cast your vote
Choose the option that best reflects your reality
Add a comment if your answer is ‘it depends’

poll_structure_guidelines.primary_role: Turn a real strategic or operational question into structured input from your network.
best_practices: Ensure each option is understandable at a glance

hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Use tags connected to the audience you want to hear from.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Optionally tag a small number of relevant experts or colleagues to kick-start engagement.

technical_constraints.visibility_note: Polls can be boosted by early engagement, so initial responses are important.

required_elements: Answer options that are mutually exclusive
Context for why the question matters
disallowed_practices: Joke answers that make results unusable for insight (unless the poll is explicitly playful)
More than one question embedded in the caption
Options that overlap or confuse respondents
